alert.note: Alert for Fremont (Colorado) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued August 04 at 6:24PM MDT until August 04 at 8:15PM MDT by NWS Pueblo
info.description: ...FLASH FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 815 PM MDT THIS EVENING FOR SOUTHEASTERN FREMONT COUNTY... At 624 PM MDT, Emergency Management reported flash flooding from thunderstorms that occurred earlier in the warned area. Flash flooding is already occurring. HAZARD...Flash flooding caused by thunderstorms. SOURCE...Emergency management reported 6 feet of water with mud and debris in water crossings, located between Mile Markers 10 and 14 along Copper Gulch Road. IMPACT...Flash flooding of small creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses as well as other poor drainage and low-lying areas. Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Far southern portions of the Canon City area This includes the following streams and drainages... Arkansas River, Grape Creek, South Oak Creek, South Newlin Creek, Mineral Creek, Chandler Creek, Texas Creek, Sandy Creek, Oak Creek, Copper Gulch and Newlin Creek. FLASH FLOOD...OBSERVED
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
